      • INITIAL_DELAY

        public static final int INITIAL_DELAY
        initial delay for ading progress indication into the UI. if finishes earlier, not shown at all, applies just to the status line (default) comtroller.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefault

        public static Controller getDefault()

      • createWorker

        protected ProgressUIWorkerWithModel createWorker()
        Creates a worker. The default implementation creates a trivial no-op worker. Subclasses should override to create a meaningful worker implementation.
        Returns:
        worker instance

      • getProgressUIWorker

        protected final ProgressUIWorker getProgressUIWorker()
        Retrieves the ProgressUIWorker instance. The instance is lazily created by calling createWorker().
        Returns:
        ProgressUIWorker instance

      • getModel

        public TaskModel getModel()

      • resetTimer

        protected void resetTimer(int delay,
                          boolean activate)
        The method is responsible to start or stop a timing service in the environment. If "delay" is 0 or less, the method should stop the timer, or at least not call the runEvents() if the timer ticks.

        If "delay" is positive, the method should configure the timer to fire after "delay" milliseconds. Depending on "restart" parameter, the timer should be just configured (false), or activated (true) - potentially canceling the previous schedule.

        The default implementation uses RequestProcessor for scheduling.

        Parameters:
        delay - delay in milliseconds before the timer should fire
        activate - if true, activate the changes immediately.

      • getEventExecutor

        protected Executor getEventExecutor()
        Executes runnable synchronously with controller's event dispatch. The method is used by Progress API to deliver other events which do not therefore interfere with Controller's own events. If called from the thread dispatching events, the executed Runnables will be delayed after the and may be interleaved by dispatched events.

        The method must be overriden by a controller implementation which changes the threading model from the default one.

        Returns:
        the executor instance
        Since:
        1.44

      • runEvents

        protected void runEvents()
        Processes the queued events. Depending on environment, planning to a specific thread, or passing some specific information may be necessary.

      • runNow

        public void runNow()
